markdownRemark.html:
Score: 92.5

trib.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of the Casper Star-Tribune, a daily newspaper covering Casper, Wyoming, and the central portion of the state.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Casper Star-Tribune is owned by Iowa-based Lee Enterprises, a publicly traded company that owns more than 40 daily newspapers, including The St. Louis Post-Dispatch. The Start-Tribune generates revenue from advertising and subscriptions to its print and digital editions.

Content

Trib.com covers local and state government, crime, education, the outdoors, and business, especially the coal, alternative energy, and beef industries. An opinion section runs local and syndicated columnists, as well as editorials by the Star-Tribune’s editorial board. Sports coverage includes high school and University of Wyoming sports and rodeo.

Trib.com also runs national and international content from The Associated Press.

Credibility

Star-Tribune reporters conduct original reporting, and articles on the site typically are well-sourced and balanced. Headlines accurately reflect the content of articles.

The site runs corrections at the bottom of articles, noting the error and how it was corrected. Opinion is published in a separate section.

In 2017, the Casper Star-Tribune won the Wyoming Press Association’s General Excellence award for daily newspapers.

Transparency

Stories include the writer’s name, phone number, and email address. A Staff page includes contact information for editorial personnel, while the Contact page provides general newsroom contact details.

The website does not disclose ownership information, other than in a “© 2018 Lee Enterprises” notice at the bottom of the site’s menu bar. NewsGuard does not consider that to be adequate ownership disclosure.

“Anyone who clicks on the menu bar of our website will see the name of our owner, Lee Enterprises,” Star Tribune Editor Josh Wolfson said, referring to the copyright notice. “I’d also note,” he added, “that we usually identify our owner in stories concerning our own operations.”

History

The Casper Star-Tribune was founded in 1891.

Written by:
Jennie Kamin

Edited by:
Josh Keefe Eric Effron
